verses.plain: How doth the city sit solitary, that was full of people! how is she become as a widow! she that was great among the nations, and princess among the provinces, how is she become tributary!

tokens.t: How doth the city sit solitary,
full of people!
is she become as a widow! she
great among the nations,
princess among the provinces,
is she become tributary!

verses.plain: She weepeth sore in the night, and her tears are on her cheeks: among all her lovers she hath none to comfort her: all her friends have dealt treacherously with her, they are become her enemies.

tokens.t: She weepeth sore in the night, and her tears
on her cheeks: among all her lovers she hath none to comfort
all her friends have dealt treacherously with her, they are become her enemies.

verses.plain: Judah is gone into captivity because of affliction, and because of great servitude: she dwelleth among the heathen, she findeth no rest: all her persecutors overtook her between the straits.

tokens.t: Judah is gone into captivity because of affliction, and because of great servitude: she dwelleth among the heathen, she findeth no rest: all her persecutors overtook her between the straits.

verses.plain: The ways of Zion do mourn, because none come to the solemn feasts: all her gates are desolate: her priests sigh, her virgins are afflicted, and she is in bitterness.

tokens.t: The ways of Zion do mourn, because none come to the solemn feasts: all her gates are desolate: her priests sigh, her virgins are afflicted, and she
in bitterness.

verses.plain: Her adversaries are the chief, her enemies prosper; for the LORD hath afflicted her for the multitude of her transgressions: her children are gone into captivity before the enemy.

tokens.t: Her adversaries are the chief, her enemies prosper; for the
hath afflicted her for the multitude of her transgressions: her children are gone into captivity before the enemy.

verses.plain: And from the daughter of Zion all her beauty is departed: her princes are become like harts that find no pasture, and they are gone without strength before the pursuer.

tokens.t: And from the daughter of Zion all her beauty is departed: her princes are become like harts
find no pasture, and they are gone without strength before the pursuer.

verses.plain: Jerusalem remembered in the days of her affliction and of her miseries all her pleasant things that she had in the days of old, when her people fell into the hand of the enemy, and none did help her: the adversaries saw her, and did mock at her sabbaths.

tokens.t: Jerusalem remembered in the days of her affliction and of her miseries all her pleasant things that she had in the days of old, when her people fell into the hand of the enemy, and none did help her: the adversaries saw her,
did mock at her sabbaths.

verses.plain: Jerusalem hath grievously sinned; therefore she is removed: all that honoured her despise her, because they have seen her nakedness: yea, she sigheth, and turneth backward.

tokens.t: Jerusalem hath grievously sinned; therefore she is removed: all that honoured her despise her, because they have seen her nakedness: yea, she sigheth, and turneth backward.

verses.plain: Her filthiness is in her skirts; she remembereth not her last end; therefore she came down wonderfully: she had no comforter. O LORD, behold my affliction: for the enemy hath magnified himself.

tokens.t: Her filthiness
in her skirts; she remembereth not her last end; therefore she came down wonderfully: she had no comforter. O
, behold my affliction: for the enemy hath magnified

verses.plain: The adversary hath spread out his hand upon all her pleasant things: for she hath seen that the heathen entered into her sanctuary, whom thou didst command that they should not enter into thy congregation.

tokens.t: The adversary hath spread out his hand upon all her pleasant things: for she hath seen
the heathen entered into her sanctuary, whom thou didst command
they should not enter into thy congregation.

verses.plain: All her people sigh, they seek bread; they have given their pleasant things for meat to relieve the soul: see, O LORD, and consider; for I am become vile.

tokens.t: All her people sigh, they seek bread; they have given their pleasant things for meat to relieve the soul: see, O
, and consider; for I am become vile.

verses.plain: ¶ Is it nothing to you, all ye that pass by? behold, and see if there be any sorrow like unto my sorrow, which is done unto me, wherewith the LORD hath afflicted me in the day of his fierce anger.

tokens.t: nothing to you, all ye that pass by? behold, and see if there be any sorrow like unto my sorrow, which is done unto me, wherewith the
hath afflicted
in the day of his fierce anger.

verses.plain: From above hath he sent fire into my bones, and it prevaileth against them: he hath spread a net for my feet, he hath turned me back: he hath made me desolate and faint all the day.

tokens.t: From above hath he sent fire into my bones, and it prevaileth against them: he hath spread a net for my feet, he hath turned me back: he hath made me desolate
faint all the day.

verses.plain: The yoke of my transgressions is bound by his hand: they are wreathed, and come up upon my neck: he hath made my strength to fall, the Lord hath delivered me into their hands, from whom I am not able to rise up.

tokens.t: The yoke of my transgressions is bound by his hand: they are wreathed,
come up upon my neck: he hath made my strength to fall, the Lord hath delivered me into
hands,
I am not able to rise up.

verses.plain: The Lord hath trodden under foot all my mighty men in the midst of me: he hath called an assembly against me to crush my young men: the Lord hath trodden the virgin, the daughter of Judah, as in a winepress.

tokens.t: The Lord hath trodden under foot all my mighty
in the midst of me: he hath called an assembly against me to crush my young men: the Lord hath trodden the virgin, the daughter of Judah,
in a winepress.

verses.plain: For these things I weep; mine eye, mine eye runneth down with water, because the comforter that should relieve my soul is far from me: my children are desolate, because the enemy prevailed.

tokens.t: For these
I weep; mine eye, mine eye runneth down with water, because the comforter that should relieve my soul is far from me: my children are desolate, because the enemy prevailed.

verses.plain: Zion spreadeth forth her hands, and there is none to comfort her: the LORD hath commanded concerning Jacob, that his adversaries should be round about him: Jerusalem is as a menstruous woman among them.

tokens.t: Zion spreadeth forth her hands,
none to comfort her: the
hath commanded concerning Jacob,
his adversaries
round about him: Jerusalem is as a menstruous woman among them.

verses.plain: ¶ The LORD is righteous; for I have rebelled against his commandment: hear, I pray you, all people, and behold my sorrow: my virgins and my young men are gone into captivity.

tokens.t: ¶ The
is righteous; for I have rebelled against his commandment: hear, I pray you, all people, and behold my sorrow: my virgins and my young men are gone into captivity.

verses.plain: I called for my lovers, but they deceived me: my priests and mine elders gave up the ghost in the city, while they sought their meat to relieve their souls.

tokens.t: I called for my lovers,
they deceived me: my priests and mine elders gave up the ghost in the city, while they sought their meat to relieve their souls.

verses.plain: Behold, O LORD; for I am in distress: my bowels are troubled; mine heart is turned within me; for I have grievously rebelled: abroad the sword bereaveth, at home there is as death.

tokens.t: Behold, O
; for I
in distress: my bowels are troubled; mine heart is turned within me; for I have grievously rebelled: abroad the sword bereaveth, at home
as death.

verses.plain: They have heard that I sigh: there is none to comfort me: all mine enemies have heard of my trouble; they are glad that thou hast done it: thou wilt bring the day that thou hast called, and they shall be like unto me.

tokens.t: They have heard that I sigh:
none to comfort me: all mine enemies have heard of my trouble; they are glad that thou hast done
thou wilt bring the day
thou hast called, and they shall be like unto me.

verses.plain: Let all their wickedness come before thee; and do unto them, as thou hast done unto me for all my transgressions: for my sighs are many, and my heart is faint.

tokens.t: Let all their wickedness come before thee; and do unto them, as thou hast done unto me for all my transgressions: for my sighs
many, and my heart
faint.

footnotes.text: because of great…: Heb. for the greatness of servitude
is…: Heb. is become a removing, or, wandering
to…: or, to make the soul to come again
Is it…: or, It is nothing
pass by: Heb. pass by the way?
the virgin…: or, the winepress of the virgin, etc
